info.name: CUALA API
info.description: Collection for testing CUALA test automation API endpoints. Uses unified executor that automatically chooses DOM or Vision for each step.

request.description: Check if the API server is running

Execute a test scenario synchronously (waits for completion). The unified executor automatically chooses DOM or Vision for each step. failFast (default: true) determines if execution stops on first error.

exec: // Save planId and scenarioId to environment variables
console.log('Note: Plan already existed, returning existing plan');

request.description:
Generate an execution plan without executing it (dry run). Useful for testing and debugging to see what plan would be generated. The unified executor will automatically choose DOM or Vision for each step during execution.

**Response Fields:**
- `success` (boolean): Always `true` for successful responses
- `alreadyExists` (boolean): `true` if the plan already existed for this scenario, `false` if a new plan was created
- `planId` (string): The plan identifier
- `scenarioId` (string): The scenario identifier
- `scenario` (string): The original scenario text/description
- `name` (string): Human-readable plan name
- `steps` (array): Array of execution steps
- `totalSteps` (number): Total number of steps
- `message` (string): Descriptive message indicating whether plan was reused or newly created
Get the scenarioId for a given scenario description. Useful for looking up execution history.

item.name: Execute Async

exec: // Save testId and scenarioId to environment variables

request.description: Start an async test execution. Returns immediately with testId and scenarioId. The unified executor automatically chooses DOM or Vision for each step. failFast (default: true) determines if execution stops on first error.
Get the current status of a specific test execution by testId. Returns progress, steps, and execution results.
Get all test execution statuses. Returns a list of all tests with their status, progress, plan names, and execution details. Results are sorted by creation time (newest first).

Delete a specific execution by test ID. This permanently removes the execution record from storage. Use testId from execute or execute-async response.

**Response Fields:**
- `success` (boolean): Always `true` for successful deletions
- `testId` (string): The deleted test ID
- `scenarioId` (string): The scenario ID of the deleted execution
- `message` (string): Confirmation message
Delete all execution statuses from storage. This permanently removes all execution records. Use with caution!
Get all execution history for a scenario (all test runs with the same scenario description). Use scenarioId from execute or execute-async response.
Get the most recent execution for a scenario. Use scenarioId from execute or execute-async response.

exec: // Save planId to environment variable if available

request.description:
Get the execution plan by planId. Use planId from execution status or latest execution response.

**Response Fields:**
- `planId` (string): The plan identifier
- `scenarioId` (string): The scenario identifier
- `scenario` (string): The original scenario text/description
- `name` (string): Human-readable plan name
- `phase` (string): Plan phase (initial, refined, adaptive)
- `steps` (array): Array of execution steps
- `refinementHistory` (array): History of plan refinements
- `createdAt` (number): Timestamp when plan was created

List all execution plans. Returns a list of all plans with their details including plan ID, name, scenario ID, scenario text, steps count, and creation time. Results are sorted by creation time (newest first).

**Response Fields:**
- `totalPlans` (number): Total number of plans
- `plans` (array): Array of plan objects, each containing:
  - `planId` (string): The plan identifier
  - `scenarioId` (string): The scenario identifier
  - `scenario` (string): The original scenario text/description
  - `name` (string): Human-readable plan name
  - `phase` (string): Plan phase (initial, refined, adaptive)
  - `totalSteps` (number): Total number of steps
  - `createdAt` (number): Timestamp when plan was created
  - `steps` (array): Array of step summaries
Update an existing plan by planId. You can update the plan name, phase, steps, or other properties. Note: plan ID and scenario ID cannot be changed.
Delete an execution plan by planId. This permanently removes the plan from storage.
Delete all execution plans from storage. This permanently removes all plans. Use with caution!

exec: // Save testId and scenarioId to environment variables

request.description: Execute a plan by plan ID synchronously (waits for completion). Returns full execution results. failFast (default: true) determines if execution stops on first error.

exec: // Save testId, planId and scenarioId to environment variables

request.description: Execute a plan by plan ID asynchronously (returns immediately with testId). Returns immediately with testId and planId. failFast (default: true) determines if execution stops on first error.

item.description: Async execution endpoints for long-running tests. The unified executor automatically chooses DOM or Vision for each step.

item.name: Configuration

request.description:
Get all confidence thresholds for element discovery. Returns both configured values and defaults. Confidence thresholds (0.0 to 1.0) control the minimum confidence level required for element discovery to accept a found element.

**Response Fields:**
- `thresholds` (array): Array of threshold objects with `actionType` and `threshold`
- `total` (number): Total number of thresholds returned

item.name: Get Confidence Threshold by Action Type

request.description:
Get confidence threshold for a specific action type. Valid action types: `click`, `type`, `hover`, `verify`, `default`.

**Response Fields:**
- `actionType` (string): The action type
- `threshold` (number): The confidence threshold value (0.0 to 1.0)
- `isDefault` (boolean): `true` if using default value, `false` if configured
- `config` (object): Configuration metadata if configured

Create or update confidence threshold for a specific action type. Valid action types: `click`, `type`, `hover`, `verify`, `default`.

**Request Body:**
- `threshold` (number, required): Confidence threshold value between 0.0 and 1.0
- `description` (string, optional): Description of the threshold configuration

**Response Fields:**
- `actionType` (string): The action type
- `threshold` (number): The set threshold value
- `configKey` (string): The configuration key used
- `message` (string): Success message

Delete a confidence threshold configuration, reverting it to the default value from .env file. Valid action types: `click`, `type`, `hover`, `verify`, `default`.

**Response Fields:**
- `actionType` (string): The action type
- `threshold` (number): The default threshold value after deletion
- `message` (string): Confirmation message

Delete all confidence threshold configurations, reverting all to default values from .env file. Use with caution!

**Response Fields:**
- `message` (string): Confirmation message
- `defaults` (object): Object containing all default threshold values

item.description: Configuration endpoints for managing confidence thresholds that control element discovery accuracy. Thresholds can be configured per action type (click, type, hover, verify) or as a default. Lower thresholds allow more lenient element matching, while higher thresholds require more confident matches.

Example with failFast set to false - execution continues even if a step fails

item.description: Example scenarios for testing. All use unified executor that automatically chooses DOM or Vision.
